description: This script automatically detects the type of database (SQLite, PostgreSQL, MySQL/MariaDB, or MongoDB) running on the system and creates a backup accordingly. It first checks for SQLite, then PostgreSQL, then MySQL (via multiple connection methods), and finally MongoDB, generating backup files for each if the database is detected as active.

methods.name: main backup logic (not explicitly named, entire script serves as procedure)
methods.description: Detects the running database type and executes the corresponding backup command, handling different connection methods and fallback options.
